channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Giant Pandas are returning to D.C.'s National Zoo
item.description: D.C.'s National Zoo will soon welcome a new pair of Giant Pandas
item.content:encoded:
D.C.'s National Zoo will soon welcome a new pair of Giant Pandas

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Jacob Fenston

item.title: South Korea says the North has flown balloons carrying trash over the border
item.description: South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said North Korea has been flying balloons carrying trash toward the South in an apparent retaliation to anti-Pyongyang propaganda leaflets flown across the border.
item.content:encoded:
South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said North Korea has been flying balloons carrying trash toward the South in an apparent retaliation to anti-Pyongyang propaganda leaflets flown across the border.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: From Pop-Tarts to Happy Meals, a food writer recreates American classics with an Asian flavor
item.description: While the restaurant world diversifies, Taiwanese American food creator Frankie Gaw saw American grocery stores still stocked with the same ingredients and flavors from decades ago. So, he came up with his own versions of Cheerios and Pop-Tarts.
item.content:encoded:
While the restaurant world diversifies, Taiwanese American food creator Frankie Gaw saw American grocery stores still stocked with the same ingredients and flavors from decades ago. So, he came up with his own versions of Cheerios and Pop-Tarts.

(Image credit: Frankie Gaw)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: White evangelical Christians are some of Israel's biggest supporters. Why?
item.description: As war continues to rage in the Middle East, attention has been turned to how American Jews, Muslims, and Palestinians relate to the state of Israel. But when we talk about the region, American Christians, particularly evangelical Christians, are often not part of that story. But their political support for Israel is a major driver for U.S. policy — in part because Evangelicals make up an organized, dedicated constituency with the numbers to exert major influence on U.S. politics.
item.content:encoded: As war continues to rage in the Middle East, attention has been turned to how American Jews, Muslims, and Palestinians relate to the state of Israel. But when we talk about the region, American Christians, particularly evangelical Christians, are often not part of that story. But their political support for Israel is a major driver for U.S. policy — in part because Evangelicals make up an organized, dedicated constituency with the numbers to exert major influence on U.S. politics.
item.dc:creator: Gene Demby

item.title: The last words: What each side said in closing arguments for Trump's New York trial
item.description: The former president's defense team dismissed the prosecution's witnesses, while the prosecution focused on Trump's business practices and alleged motives. The trial is in the jury's hands Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
The former president's defense team dismissed the prosecution's witnesses, while the prosecution focused on Trump's business practices and alleged motives. The trial is in the jury's hands Wednesday.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Israel pushes deeper into Rafah after deadly strike at camp for displaced Gazans
item.description: The moves comes despite an order from the top U.N. court for Israel to halt its offensive in southern Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
The moves comes despite an order from the top U.N. court for Israel to halt its offensive in southern Gaza.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Pope Francis apologizes for using slur referring to gay men
item.description: “The Pope never intended to offend or express himself in homophobic terms” during a closed-door discussion among bishops earlier this month, according to a Vatican press official.
item.content:encoded:
“The Pope never intended to offend or express himself in homophobic terms” during a closed-door discussion among bishops earlier this month, according to a Vatican press official.

(Image credit: Filippo Monteforte)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: Melinda French Gates to give $1 billion to women's rights groups
item.description: The 59-year-old says her decision to donate $1 billion was in part due to the racial gap in women's mortality rates. She most recently stepped down as co-chair of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.
item.content:encoded:
The 59-year-old says her decision to donate $1 billion was in part due to the racial gap in women's mortality rates. She most recently stepped down as co-chair of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: How Israel's Assault on Rafah is Unfolding
item.description:
Israel has expanded its military operation in the southern Gaza city of Rafah. This comes after an Israeli airstrike on Sunday near a displaced persons camp started a fire killing at least 45 people and injuring hundreds more. We hear details from our correspondent in Tel Aviv.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.content:encoded:
Israel has expanded its military operation in the southern Gaza city of Rafah. This comes after an Israeli airstrike on Sunday near a displaced persons camp started a fire killing at least 45 people and injuring hundreds more. We hear details from our correspondent in Tel Aviv.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Bette Nash, the world's longest-serving flight attendant, dies at 88
item.description: Nash began her career in 1957 when flight attendants handed out cigarettes and got weighed before shifts. She earned her Guinness World Record after 64 years of service in 2022 — then kept working.
item.content:encoded:
Nash began her career in 1957 when flight attendants handed out cigarettes and got weighed before shifts. She earned her Guinness World Record after 64 years of service in 2022 — then kept working.

(Image credit: Eric Baradat)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
